awd_titl_txt: Phase I IUCRC The Georgia Institute of Technology: Center for Fiber-Wireless Integration and Networking for Heterogeneous Mobile Data Communications (FiWIN)
awd_abstract_narration:
The Fiber-Wireless Integration and Networking (FiWIN) Center for Heterogeneous Mobile Data Communications is an NSF Industry/University Cooperative Research Program (I/UCRC) led by the Georgia Institute of Technology (GT) since 2015. Based on recognized research leadership and accumulated expertise in integrated fiber-wireless access technologies, FiWIN is favorably positioned to make substantial contributions to access network architectures, functional designs of network elements, and optimized system interfaces and operations for the globally competitive next generation mobile communication networks. FiWIN has successfully completed the first three years of operation. The center expands its scope with the addition of Auburn University (AU) as a Member Site in 2018.

GT has been and continues to be a leading global player in the development of fiber wireless integration and networking technologies for delivering high data rate, large capacity and low latency multi-band 5G services. The combined expertise of AU and GT will expand FiWIN's scope to develop radio frequency (RF) integrated circuits for beamforming in coordinated multi-point transmission, in mission-critical sensors for industrial and health Internet of Things (IoT) applications and in heterogeneous cell coverage with mobile edge computing. Mutual synergy will foster advances in data compression algorithms, bandwidth efficient waveform and modulation, and machine learning to autonomously mitigate nonlinear behaviors of 5G network elements.

An affordable and reliable advanced communication network will drive academic innovation and business agility for providing a vital gateway for economic and societal growth. The continuing rise of social media and artificial intelligence will revolutionize on how we interact with the internet, the machines and with one another. It will enable new kinds of data analytics to be harnessed for tangible business, education and everyday life benefits. Outcomes of our research will be innovative technologies to benefit US competitive industrial offerings for 5G systems and cloud/fog computing by teaching and fostering students to be ready for a versatile and skilled workforce. 

All FiWIN Center research products are published in archival journals or conference proceedings in compliance according to the Center's Membership agreement and Bylaws. A reference library containing archival research products (Annual reports, Industrial Advisory Board (IAB) presentations, student project proposals and outcome presentations, and a list of publications) will be maintained and updated and be accessible to FiWIN Center Members, FiWIN research team members, and general public with security protection for a period of 5 years after the Center has graduated. An interactive web-based server http://fiwin.org will be used for sharing scientific data products with IAB members and the public.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
FiWIN Tangible Project Outcomes 2015-2022.

 

  • The internationally competitive Marconi Society "Paul Baran Young Scholar Award? for academic researchers below the age of 27, was awarded to 3 FiWIN student project leaders for their outstanding research contributions in next generation fiber-wireless integrated systems and networks for mobile data communications in 2016, 2019 and 2022. This marks the first time in GT history that this award has been awarded to any GT student and all were awarded to students under the guidance of Professor Gee-Kung Chang, as the FiWIN Director.
  • 17 Ph. D. students, one of which was offered a faculty position, and 3 M. S. students graduated and were placed in industry.
  • 4 post-docs placed in industry.
  • 20 student Summer Internships.
  • 2 posdoc Summer Internships.
  • A total of 181 journal and conference publications.
    1. 69 in peer-reviewed prestigious Journals.
    2. 112 presentations/publications in peer-reviewed prestigious conferences.
  • 4 student awards.
  • 2 post-doc awards with one post-doc receiving two awards;
  • 5 visiting scholars mentored GT graduate students.

Strategic objective of the Project:

 

The global communication network infrastructure is growing to accommodate accelerated demand for data proliferation, while service providers compete to fulfill ever increasing data bandwidth demand for better quality of experience at lower cost over denser, lower latency, and wider areas of coverage. The European Union set aside nearly ?80 billion of public and private investments for Horizon 2020, a cutting-edge research program that seeks to streamline and shorten the transition time from discoveries and engineering breakthroughs to the marketplace.

Since its inception, FiWIN has aimed to be the focal point in the US that is dedicated to the development of novel 5G and 6G radio access network technologies. FiWIN has pioneered millimeter wave (mmWave) radio over fiber (RoF), digital signal processing, advanced waveform and machine-learning technologies to deliver reliable and efficient optical and wireless services since 2015, and has since been at the forefront of the development of heterogeneous mobile access networks, all spectrum integration scenarios and artificial neural networks to optimize network performance in 5G and prepare for the technology challenges that are expected to unfold in the next wireless generation.

 

While the global roll-out of 5G in 2020, major overseas wireless R&D centers and universities, including FiWIN, the only 5G/6G fiber-wireless integrated network research center in the US, have been mapping out research challenges to meet the ?post-5G? business and societal needs.

 

Over the last two years of its Phase I award, FiWIN has focused on the development of:

  • Artificial Intelligence (AI)-enhanced mobile-edge computing in 6G fiber-wireless Radio Access Networks.
  • Develop the concept of interpenetrating phased arrays to greatly enhance mmWave MIMO throughput without massive panels.
  • AI allocation and management of networks resource-blocks in service-specific dynamic network slicing.
  • Future multiple access waveforms providing efficient low-latency scheduling at the mobile edge, and
  • AI-assisted Interference detection and mitigation of 6G access networks.

Intellectual Merit: FiWIN has advanced technical knowledge by developing and initially demonstrating fundamental components of an all-spectrum, autonomically resilient access networks at the adaptive mobile edge comprising seamlessly integrated optical fiber, RF, millimeter wave, sub-THz, and free-space lightwave communication. These integrated concepts of system integration will not only drive technical innovation and business growth, but will also stimulate theoretical analyses and mathematical models needed to advance the foundations of fiber wireless access architecture, end-to-end network slicing on demand, to enable innovative and diverse new applications. Novel fronthaul-backhaul concepts are needed to leverage the unique properties availed by the optical domain, (e.g. range, bandwidth efficiency, capacity) to enable dynamic allocation of RF, mm-W and light wave spectral resources for optimized network performance.

 

Broader Impact: An all-spectrum, autonomic resilient Information and Communication Network comprising seamlessly integrated fiber-optic, RF, millimeter wave, sub-tera Hertz, and free-space lightwave technologies will not only drive business innovation and growth, but will provide a vital gateway for economic and societal growth and further scientific and engineering innovations. The continuing rise of the relevance of social media is an important part of how we interact with the internet and with one another, and enables new kinds of intelligent analytics ready to be harnessed for tangible business, education and everyday life benefits.

Outcomes of FiWIN project will usher in innovative networking technologies and their dissemination to benefit US competitive industrial offerings for 5G and next generation mobile connectivity such as new radio, mm-Wave and sub-THz high performance fiber-wireless access for cloud and mobile edge computing. Young students will be trained in the disciplines of advanced engineering, mathematics, artificial intelligence and computer science. Corresponding university curricula will be developed to stimulate interest in science and technology among the broader community by engaging sponsored outreach opportunities afforded by, for example, the Georgia Tech summer internships for high school teachers, a program that provides K-12 STEM teachers with paid summer internships to experience actual advanced research alongside graduate students.

 

 


Last Modified: 12/19/2022
Modified by: Gee-Kung Chang
